title: Style: “IVORY” INKA BOOT
body:
[**#gallery-1 { margin: auto; } #gallery-1 .gallery-item { float: left; margin-top: 10px; text-align: center; width: 33%; } #gallery-1 img { border: 2px solid #cfcfcf; } #gallery-1 .gallery-caption { margin-left: 0; } /\* see gallery\_shortcode() in wp-includes/media.php \*/**](http://before1444.com/store/)

**](http://before1444.com/store/)

[](http://before1444.com/store/)

[](http://before1444.com/store/)

[**GOLD COAST TRADING**](http://before1444.com/store/) take the street wear formula and do something genuinely interesting with it. Picking up imagery and symbolism from the Mayans, Aztecs, and Incas, they combine within some pieces that can’t fail to stand out from the crowd. Their grommets are perhaps their most interesting item; each pair is lined with authentic African wax fabrics, each having a double leather sole and built-in insole. They’re quite pricey at $150, but ultimately worth it in terms of design. Check them out over at their [**website**.](http://before1444.com/store/)
